meanings.definition: In a wicked or evil manner
meanings.sent1: The witch cackled villainously as she cast her spell.
meanings.sent2: He glared villainously at his enemies before launching his attack.
meanings.sent3: The cat villainously knocked over the vase and then pretended to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered villainously in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The villainously dark forest seemed to whisper secrets to those who dared to enter.

meanings.sent1: The villainously twisted smile sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent2: His villainously black cape billowed behind him as he strode into the room.
meanings.sent3: The villainously sharp eyes seemed to see through all his lies.
meanings.sent4: The villainously cunning plan unfolded with precision and malice.
meanings.sent5: The villainously laughter echoed through the halls, striking fear into all who heard.

meanings.definition: Acting in a deceitful or malicious way
meanings.sent1: She gave him a villainously sweet smile before betraying him.
meanings.sent2: The villainously charming man turned out to be a fraud.
meanings.sent3: The villainously clever fox outsmarted all the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her villainously smooth words hid her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The villainously sly thief slipped away into the night, leaving no trace behind.
